com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.implementations.sequence

Class SequenceTrack

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.implementations.sequence.SequenceTrack

  • public class SequenceTrack
extends Object
    A Sequence Track is a list of annotations that is associated with a sequence (in addition to those supplied by SequenceDocument.getSequenceAnnotations()).

    A SequenceDocument may implement SequenceTrack.Manager.Provider if it provides sequence tracks. The SequenceTrack.Manager allows tracks on the sequence to be added, edited and deleted. A SequenceAlignmentDocument may implement SequenceTrack.Manager.Provider if it provides sequence tracks on its consensus sequence. The recommended way to get existing tracks on a sequence is to use getTrackManager(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.sequence.SequenceDocument) followed by SequenceTrack.Manager.getTracks().

    In addition to providing annotations, sequence tracks also have a list of SequenceAnnotationQualifiers (name/value pairs) associated with the entire track. See getQualifiers()

    After any changes are made to a track, the SequenceDocument still needs to be saved via AnnotatedPluginDocument.saveDocument()

    When an existing SequenceTrack.Manager is loaded, meta data for all tracks is loaded into memory, but annotations on each track are only loaded on demand via getSequenceAnnotations(jebl.util.ProgressListener)

    The recommended way to create a track on a single sequence is to use new SequenceTrack ( TrackManager.getUniqueTrackName(namePrefix))

    For sequence lists, in Geneious at the code level there isn't a concept of a track that spans multiple sequences. However, when viewing a sequence list, the sequence viewer makes all tracks that have the same getName() appear as a single track to the user. This means that if the user edits the name or track qualifiers of a track, the sequence viewer will apply those changes to all tracks in that sequence list with the same id. To create a track spanning multiple sequences, but with a unique name, pass the track managers from all sequences to Manager.getUniqueTrackName(managers, namePrefix).

    Annotations of the following types must not be placed on sequence tracks or the sequence/alignment viewer may not work correctly with them: TRIMMED , EDITING_HISTORY_DELETION, EDITING_HISTORY_INSERTION, EDITING_HISTORY_REPLACEMENT, OVERHANG, LIGATION, CONCATENATED_SEQUENCE, EXTRACTED_REGION, TRANSLATED_REGION. Instead those annotation types should only appear in the annotations returned from SequenceDocument.getSequenceAnnotations. This list is available in ANNOTATION_TYPES_NEVER_ON_TRACKS.

    Unlike the annotations returned from SequenceDocument.getSequenceAnnotations, the annotations in tracks are not duplicated inside alignments that store references to their ungapped sequence. Instead alignment implementations automatically fetch and insert gaps into track data on demand. For example, consider an ungapped sequence GATTACA which has an annotation from bases 2->4. An alignment has this sequence as GA-TTACA but it doesn't store a copy of the track. However, any code that calls getTrackManager on the alignment sequence will see a track with an annotation covering bases 2->5. Any changes to this track will propagate back to the referenced sequence. The alignment sequence's implementation of getTrackManager will return a track manager created using createGapInsertingManager on the track manager obtained from the referenced sequence.

    Since:
    API 4.50 (Geneious 5.5.0)

    • Field Detail

      • ANNOTATION_TYPES_NEVER_ON_TRACKS

        public static final List<String> ANNOTATION_TYPES_NEVER_ON_TRACKS
        A list of annotation types that must not be places on sequence tracks. See SequenceTrack for what this list contains.

      • DESCRIPTION_QUALIFIER

        public static final String DESCRIPTION_QUALIFIER
        The name of a qualifier (whose value can be obtained from getQualifiers() that describes this track. The description may contain html, if it begins with <html>
        Since:
        API 4.60 (Geneious 5.6.0)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SequenceTrack

        public SequenceTrack(org.jdom.Element element)
              throws XMLSerializationException
        Deserializes a track from XML.
        Parameters:
        element - and element returned from a previous call to toXML(String)
        Throws:
        XMLSerializationException - if the track can't be deserialized

      • SequenceTrack

        public SequenceTrack(String name)
        Creates a new SequenceTrack.
        Parameters:
        name - the name for this track.

        If you are creating a track inside a SequenceAnnotationGenerator, there is no need to make the name unique. The sequence viewer and core Geneious will automatically ensure the name is unique in the document. For alignments/contigs with reference sequences it is a good idea to append a suffix describing the sample name. See getSuggestedTrackNameSuffixForAlignmentWithReferenceSequence.

        If you are manually adding tracks to sequences, it is a good idea to ensure the name is unique on this associated sequence by calling SequenceTrack.Manager.getUniqueTrackName(String) or unique across a set of sequences by calling SequenceTrack.Manager.getUniqueTrackName(java.util.List, String).

        public void addTrackDataFile(String identifier,
                    File dataFile)
        Add a data file to be associated with this track, a copy of which will be stored in the local database and it will not be loaded upon track load.

      • getTrackManager

        public static SequenceTrack.Manager getTrackManager(SequenceAlignmentDocument alignmentDocument)

To get the track manager for sequences in the alignment, use getTrackManager(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.documents.sequence.SequenceDocument) on the sequences returned from SequenceAlignmentDocument.getSequence(int)
        Parameters:
        alignmentDocument - the alignment to get the track manager for
        Returns:
        a track manager for this alignments consensus sequence, or null if it doesn't have one.

      • setName

        Changes the name of this track
        Parameters:
        name - the new name of this track. Must not be null. Names must not be the same as other tracks although this is not enforced here. Use SequenceTrack.Manager.getUniqueTrackName(String) to create a unique name.

      • getSequenceAnnotations

        public List<SequenceAnnotation> getSequenceAnnotations(ProgressListener progressListener)
        Gets the annotations for this track, loading them if necessary. returned annotations must not be modified.
        Parameters:
        progressListener - for reporting progress as the annotations are loaded and allowing it to be cancelled.
        Returns:
        the annotations. May only be null if the ProgressListener.isCanceled()
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - whose cause is an XMLSerializationException if there is insufficient memory to load the annotations

      • getAnnotationColoringQualifier

        public String getAnnotationColoringQualifier()
        Returns the name of a qualifier on each annotation in this track whose numeric value is used for determining the intensity of the color of that annotation is rendered in.
        Returns:
        name of a qualifier on each annotation in this track whose value is used for determining the intensity of the color of that annotation is rendered in or null to not color by a qualifier

      • setAnnotationColoringQualifier

        public void setAnnotationColoringQualifier(String coloringQualifier)
        Sets the name of a qualifier on each annotation in this track whose numeric value is used for determining the intensity of the color of that annotation is rendered in.
        Parameters:
        coloringQualifier - the name of a qualifier on each annotation in this track or null to not color by a qualifier
        See Also:
        setAnnotationColoringQualifierColors(String, java.util.Map)

      • setAnnotationColoringQualifierColors

        public void setAnnotationColoringQualifierColors(String coloringQualifier,
                                        Map<Double,Color> colorMap)
        Sets the color gradient for use with setAnnotationColoringQualifier(String). For example: the coloring qualifier has a range of 50 -100. The map will include values for 50 and 100 and the annotation colors will be interpolated between these values. Optional additional value color pairs can be provided and the gradient will move through them.
        Parameters:
        coloringQualifier - the qualifier to apply this color map for
        colorMap - Map from a particular value to the color used at that value for this qualifier
        Since:
        API 4.801 (Geneious 8.0.1)
        See Also:
        setAnnotationColoringQualifier(String)

      • getAnnotationColoringQualifierColors

        public Map<String,Map<Double,Color>> getAnnotationColoringQualifierColors()
        Gets all the color maps set by setAnnotationColoringQualifierColors(String, java.util.Map)
        Returns:
        all the color maps set by setAnnotationColoringQualifierColors(String, java.util.Map)
        Since:
        API 4.801 (Geneious 8.0.1)

      • getTrackColoringQualifiers

        public List<String> getTrackColoringQualifiers()
        Returns:
        Returns the list of qualifiers that this track would like the Sequence Viewer to display as Track Colors. If the Sequence Viewer hasn't already been told to display (or not display) these qualifiers for a document with that track on it, then they will be displayed for that document. Does not return null.
        Since:
        API 4.60 (Geneious 5.6.0)
        See Also:
        setTrackColoringQualifiers(java.util.List)

      • setTrackColoringQualifiers

        public void setTrackColoringQualifiers(List<String> trackColoringQualifiers)
        Store on this track a list of qualifiers that this track would like the Sequence Viewer to display as Track Colors. If the Sequence Viewer hasn't already been told to display (or not display) these qualifiers for a document with that track on it, then they will be displayed for that document.
        Parameters:
        trackColoringQualifiers - the qualifiers to display as Track Colors.
        Since:
        API 4.60 (Geneious 5.6.0)
        See Also:
        getTrackColoringQualifiers()

      • getDocumentVisibleByDefaultOn

        public URN getDocumentVisibleByDefaultOn()
        if this returns a not-null value then this track is only visible by default when viewed from within document with this URN. The URN may be either that returned from AnnotatedPluginDocument.getURN() or PluginDocument.getURN(). This is used for example on tracks added to contig documents. The track forwards to the referenced document and won't be visible by default when viewing the referenced document and instead will only be visible by default when viewed from that contig.
        Returns:
        if this is not-null then this track is only visible by default when viewed from within document with this URN

      • setDocumentVisibleByDefaultOn

        public void setDocumentVisibleByDefaultOn(URN documentVisibleByDefaultOn)
        Sets the document that this track is only visible by default on. See getDocumentVisibleByDefaultOn() for more information. Note: As of Geneious 8.0.1, there is a known issue where this might not always work. When just a single track for a particular annotation type, then the visibility of that track is linked with the annotation type visibility instead of stored as a preference for that track. The annotation type visibility preference is on a per 'document type' basis unlike the track visibility which is on a per 'document' basis.
        Parameters:
        documentVisibleByDefaultOn - the document that this track is only visible by default on or null.

      • getSuggestedTrackNameSuffixForAlignmentWithReferenceSequence

        public static String getSuggestedTrackNameSuffixForAlignmentWithReferenceSequence(AnnotatedPluginDocument document,
                                                                  SequenceAlignmentDocument alignment)
        Returns a suggested track name suffix to use for tracks created on an alignment with a reference sequence. This is usually the name of the sample assembled to the reference sequence). For example the variant finder appends this suffix to the text "Variants" to form the track name
        Parameters:
        document - the document the alignment or contig came from.
        alignment - the alignment or contig
        Returns:
        a suggested track name suffix or an empty string if the alignment doesn't have a reference sequence
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)
